data.quote: The remedy for worry is to get completely occupied doing something constructive.
data.author: Dale Carneige

data.quote: We must accept and cooperate with the inevitable.
data.author: Dale Carneige

data.quote: Good thinking deals with causes and effects, which leads to logical, constructive planning. Whereas, bad thinking frequently leads to tensions and nervous breakdowns.
data.author: Dale Carneige

data.quote: When worrying about a problem: Ask yourself the following: What is the worst that can possibly happen? Prepare to accept the worst-case scenario if you have to. Then calmly proceed to improve on the worst outcome which you have already mentally agreed to accept.
data.author: Dale Carneige

data.quote: Half the worry in the world is caused by people trying to make decisions before they have sufficient knowledge on which to base a decision. Tips to assist in arriving at a decision include: Gathering facts, analysing, understanding facts and ultimately arriving at a decision and acting on that decision.
data.author: Dale Carneige

data.quote: Writing down your troubles helps a lot in clarifying them. Write the following about your problems: What am I worried about? What can I do about it? Deciding what to do and starting immediately to carry out that decision.
data.author: Dale Carneige

data.quote: Just Relax, release all your nervous tense.
data.author: Dale Carneige

data.quote: Clear your desk of all papers except those relating to the immediate problem at hand.
data.author: Dale Carneige
